question: Specify any additional template transformation
details: For example, if using a template in MNI space, but reporting coordinates in Talairach, clearly note and report method used (For example, Brett’s mni2tal, Lancaster’s icbm_spm2tal)

question: What type of registration was used?

choices: B­-splines | stationary velocity field | momentum | non­parametric displacement field

question: Was regularization used?
Parameter(s) used to set degree of regularization
fsl_default: determined empirically for each category of images

question: Interpolation method used for intersubject registration

choices: trilinear | nearest neighbor | ribbon­-constrained specifying inner and outer surface use

question: Similarity metric used for intersubject registration
choices: correlation ratio | mutual information | boundary-based registration

question: Use of cost­-function masking
fsl_default: binary mask in space of --ref image

question: Voxel size in mm of the resampled, atlas-space images

question: Specify the type of intensity correction of the functional images
details: Correction of odd versus even slice intensity differences attributable to interleaved EPI acquisition without gaps
spm_default: [Bias regularisation is used, but a-priori not specified for either structural or functional image]

question: Type of scaling of image intensities before statistical modelling
details: For example SPM scales each run such that the mean image will have mean intracerebral intensity of 100; FSL scales each run such that the mean image will have an intracerebral mode of 10,000
fsl_default: FSL also has option intensity normalization, which means forcing each volume to have the same mean intensity (not checked by default; not recommended)????

question: Expansion basis and order of motion parameters used

question: Describe quality control measures
details: Summaries of subject motion (For example mean frame-wise displacement), image variance (For example DVARS), and note of any other irregularities found (For example motion or poor SNR not sufficiently severe to warrant exclusion). Should be included with any publically shared data. Summaries of subject motion, image variance, and note of any other irregularities found.
